intro: Hibbertia elegans, commonly known as the elegant hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, linear leaves. Hibbertia elegans thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and heathland environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
